intro: Epidendrum zosterifolium, commonly known as the lace-leaf epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, velvety green leaves that are often marked with silver or white veins, giving it a distinctive, ornamental appearance. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pale yellow to green flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and high humidity to flourish. Its unique foliage and elegant flowers make it a popular choice for both collectors and indoor gardeners.
